text: Right on <@U026E0ZNR>. It is stressful and scary, that we're in a time where we need to fight fascism. I'm ready to do what is necessary.

BTW, I just got an email from my friend Desiree in Seattle who is collaborating with a group of lawyers on bringing lawsuits on behalf of electors and voters regarding the extent to which electors can be bound / punished for voting their conscience. The group is being advised by Professors Tribe and Lessig, and they're looking for help in Oregon, so if we know any experts in constitutional law, or local voters who want to help back up plaintiffs, Desiree would like to get in touch and share info.
(Desiree works in local government, and co-founded a startup that successfully competed against Uber until 2012)

I just talked with Ellen Gregory, one of the lawyers in the group Desiree works with. They are specifically looking for lawyers who can practice in the federal courts in OR. This group had a success in CO today... <http://www.politico.com/story/2016/12/presidential-electors-lawsuit-trump-232255>

attachments.title: Electors take anti-Trump battle to court
attachments.text: Taking down some of the 29 state binding laws is the linchpin of their strategy.
attachments.fallback: POLITICO: Electors take anti-Trump battle to court
